docs.snippet: The Yankees are taking on that same discouraging feeling from last season: old, sad and broken....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Yankees are taking on that same discouraging feeling from last season: old, sad and broken.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column holds that as injuries pile up for New York Yankees, they are taking on that same discouraging feeling from 2013 season.

docs.snippet: Major league teams are embracing the shift on defense as never before, and it is radically reshaping how the infield looks and plays....
docs.lead_paragraph: Major league teams are embracing the shift on defense as never before, and it is radically reshaping how the infield looks and plays.
docs.abstract: Major league baseball teams are embracing the shift on defense as never before, reshaping way old game is played, and even way it looks; teams, armed with evidence that shows how batter has propensity to hit ball to certain parts of the field, will position their infielders accordingly--at times taking them far from their traditional spots.

headline.main: Who’s on Third? In Baseball’s Shifting Defenses, Maybe Nobody
headline.print_headline: Who’s on Third? In Baseball’s Shifting Defenses, Maybe Nobody

byline.contributor: Jorge Arangure Jr. and Pat Borzi contributed reporting.

docs.snippet: Saul B. Katz has reportedly been hesitant to sell because it could jeopardize Fred Wilpon’s control of the team, according to several people in baseball....
docs.lead_paragraph: Saul B. Katz has reportedly been hesitant to sell because it could jeopardize Fred Wilpon’s control of the team, according to several people in baseball.
docs.abstract: Saul B Katz, who owns a majority share of the New York Mets in a partnership with his brother-in-law and business partner, Fred Wilpon, has expressed a desire to sell his portion of the team because he has grown tired of spending millions to prop it up; has reportedly been hesitant to sell because it could jeopardize Wilpon’s continuing control of the team.

headline.main: Co-Owner of the Mets Is Said to Be Interested in Selling
headline.print_headline: Co-Owner of the Mets Is Said to Be Interested in Selling

docs.lead_paragraph: Jose Fernandez, the National League rookie of the year last season, was suffering from a sprained right elbow.
docs.abstract: Baseball Roundup; Miami Marlins ace Jose Fernandez is put on the 15-day disabled list with a sprained right elbow, spurring worries that his injury might be more severe; other MLB news and scores noted.

docs.snippet: Let's face it, there's something about a baseball movie that just invites corniness. The hardest hearts soften at the mere sound of a cracking bat.  It's hard for a filmmaker to resist laying the syrup on too thick....

docs.snippet: GORE--Michael, on May 10, 2014 in Brooklyn, NY, age 67. Formerly assistant district attorney in Brooklyn. He was a Diamond Life Master bridge player who participated in many tournaments. He also participated in the Fantasy Baseball Leagues. He is ...
docs.lead_paragraph: GORE--Michael, on May 10, 2014 in Brooklyn, NY, age 67. Formerly assistant district attorney in Brooklyn. He was a Diamond Life Master bridge player who participated in many tournaments. He also participated in the Fantasy Baseball Leagues. He is survived by his mother Tinnie and brother Arnold, sister-in-law Susan Epstein, nephew Lazar Treschan, grandniece Celia, brother-in-law Stewart Goodman, nieces Amy Goodman Moringiello, Jenni Goodman Arielly, aunt Lillian Hughes, and cousins Susan Hillman and Sondra Palenbaum. Funeral Thursday May 15, 2014, 10am, "The Riverside", 76th St. and Amsterdam Ave.
